exercise and weight loss

Options
  • Mark as New
  • Bookmark
  • Subscribe to Direct Replies to This Post
  • Subscribe to RSS Feed
  • Highlight
  • Print
  • Email to a Friend
  • Report Inappropriate Content

‎08-05-2013 08:43 PM

I am looking for some good ideas for exercise and weight loss. It seems like I have been on insulin I gained about 20 lbs and can't get the weight off. Any ideas for me?

Mary.  Diagnosed March 2009 at 33 with adult onset type 1. Pumping since Sept. 2009 with minimed 522.

‎08-06-2013 11:11 AM

Good morning,

 

I have been diabetic 38 years (age of 5) and i have spent a lifetime on this very question!  I finally have found some success finally.  My number one suggestion is Bob Harper Kettlebell workouts.  Tons of calories for the short workout, no stress on the joints and back and pounds drop like crazy.  I now do his cross fit workouts as well.  Consistency is the key along with really watching your diet.  Limit the processed carbohydrates etc.  You can also ask your dr. about metformin which is normally for type 2 diabetics but studies now show it helps Type 1 as well and it helps with weight loss and appetitie. 

 

Hope that is helpful.

Type 1 38 years
Insulin Pump
Dexcom G4 CGM

‎08-06-2013 11:49 AM

Finding something you like to do is part of the key to sticking with the exercise.  Try a few things out, there are tons of exercises with CDs, or go for a walk (especially if you have a dog!), gardening, dancing, biking, mall walking etc.... There will be something that you look forward to doing each day.   I find since I count carbs and try to eat balanced with lots of veggies, I keep the calories down at the same time. 

Good Luck!

10/4/2011 Type 1
09/13 Omnipod

Go Red Riders!! - 2014 - Signed up to Ride 62.5 miles (metric century 100K) on June 8th at Tour de Cure in Verona NY (Team Ommegang)

‎08-06-2013 08:46 PM

I finally lost weight by limiting carbs. Then I was able to limit the amount of bolus insulin I was using, as a starting point. Finally I added in simple exercise (mostly walking) and light weights so that I could avoid lows that defeated the weight loss. As I lost weight, I lowered my basal insulin too.
Pam

Diagnosed Type 1 at age 16 months, over 45 years now
Minimed pump and cgm since July '09. Metformin (insulin resistance), levothyroxine(thyroid), losartan (BP)
I have traveled cross country, and to Canada, UK, Kenya, Mexico, Jamaica, Equador/Galapagos islands, and lived in Egypt for a year.

‎08-06-2013 10:56 PM

I too been struggling to keep the weight off...Just started Bob Harpers dvds...have been doing Jillian's for awhile.. I started off with Supreme 90 day workout, with success...lost 8 lbs and couple of inches.. But when I stopped those exercises., I gained it back..  I find it frustrating, that I have to eat enough to start my workout, then eat again, afterwards to keep blood sugar levels up. I too am looking for advice on this issue.

type 1 - diagnosed 1993 (age 31)
Lantus and Humalog

‎08-07-2013 09:46 AM

Gretalt1,

 

I understand how you feel.  Nothing makes me more mad than having to eat after I work hard to burn it off.  I make sure now that i use the glucose quick sticks to bring sugar up but not consume unnecessary calories I don't need.  However, I noticed you are not on the pump and that makes it so much harder.  The pump allows me to change my basals for exercise and I don't have that long term insulin looming out there to knock me down.  Hopefully you can get on the pump and the freedom is not perfect but better than without.  When I was on Lantus and humolog, I would go running and end up eating twice what I burned to compensate.

 

Good luck to you and my heart goes out.  Healthy folks take exercise for granted while we struggle to just do the right thing. 

Type 1 38 years
Insulin Pump
Dexcom G4 CGM

‎08-07-2013 02:08 PM

Gretalt1,

As noted above, using lower calorie glucose products can be helpful to get your BG numbers up but not add as many calories.  If you are on MDI, you may also want to cut down on your meal bolus of insulin if you exercise after a meal.  I like to exercise in the am before work and usually do not take any insulin otherwise I may go too low afterwards.  This may vary per person, and is not as exact as a pump, but I find it helps to keep BG more consistent and I don't have the +4 hour crashes.

10/4/2011 Type 1
09/13 Omnipod

Go Red Riders!! - 2014 - Signed up to Ride 62.5 miles (metric century 100K) on June 8th at Tour de Cure in Verona NY (Team Ommegang)

‎08-10-2013 11:38 AM

this is the quesiton we all have!

When i started to finally "diet" and exercise I was still seeing no results, my dr informed me that insulin makes it difficult to lose weight.. Lots of water, cutting back on carbs (to cut back on insulin) is the key besides of course exercise. It just sucks how there is no miracle pill haha 

 

http://type1titans.blogspot.com/

 

http://www2.jdrf.org/goto/type1titans

 

 

Jill xoxo 

Jillian
Type 1, est 1998.
Insulin Pump

Re: exercise and weight loss

Options

‎08-13-2013 02:00 PM

What works for me is this (after years of trying different things.......not saying this will work for you)

 

I disconnect my pump 20-30 minutes prior to working out.  I have some G2 or Powerade Zero and a teaspoon of peanut butter.  Thi allows me to not go low during my workout (especially spin class- oy I used to finish in the 40s regularly!)

 

As soon as I get home, I bolus 1 unit or so and have some more G2 or Powerade Zero and a teaspoon of PB (I tend to have ketones post workout and have found that by consuming this with the PB mimics a normal body post workout- leaving my sugar fairly stable and without ketones)

 

IF I do not do a hard workout but take a really long walk (I like to do 1.5-2 hours on Sundays prior to my yoga class), I simply lower my basal rate 30 mintues before walking by almost a half and leave my pump on during the workout.......I still bolus a tad when I get home and return basal to normal.

 

It is hard to lose weight when 'eating' for a workout, and I have found that these fairly low carb options help me.

Diagnosed T1 January 1987
Pumping since 2001
Diagnosed Raynaud's January 2010
Diagnosed Lupus January 2013

‎08-13-2013 03:59 PM

Hi NDALI,

 

You caught my interest with your info about ketones and pb.  Can you tell me more about how you know you have ketones after workout?  Do you get high blood sugars after for no good reason or do you test for it?  I have some struggles with strange high blood sugars after intense or long workouts and I am hoping you can expain the PB and ketones to me a little more.  Would love to learn what you know.

 

 

Type 1 38 years
